title: Domain structure of proteins set member 1

content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the data from test <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> in Table 1 ?

choices.label: Domain <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>L</mtext></math> is required for transcription activation.

Domain <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is not required for protein-protein interaction.
Protein-protein interaction is necessary for DNA binding.
Protein-protein interaction is sufficient for transcription activation.

content.answer: Domain <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is not required for protein-protein interaction.
